metadata.title: CVE-2020-27187 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in KDE Partition Manager 4.1.0 before 4.2.0. The kpmcore_externalcommand helper contains a logic flaw in which the service invoking D-Bus is not properly checked. An attacker on the local machine can replace /etc/fstab, and execute mount and other partitioning related commands, while KDE Partition Manager is running. the mount command can then be used to gain full root privileges.

criterions.comment: kpmcore package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-2').
